frontmatter.title: Button
frontmatter.notes: TODO: Remove subcomponent of deprecated implementation soon

items.title: When to use the inline size

props.name: className
props.docblock: Specifies class name to apply to the button

description.text: Specifies class name to apply to the button

props.name: disabled
props.docblock: Disables the Button, preventing mouse events, even if the underlying component is an `<a>` element

description.text: Disables the Button, preventing mouse events, even if the underlying component is an `<a>` element

props.name: children
props.docblock: Specifies the text that is displayed within the button.

description.text: Specifies the text that is displayed within the button.

props.name: onClick
props.docblock:
A function that would specify what the button should do when the `onClick` event is triggered.
For example, the button could launch a `Modal`. The default is an empty function.

description.text:
A function that would specify what the button should do when the `onClick` event is triggered.
For example, the button could launch a `Modal`. The default is an empty function.

props.name: onKeyDown
props.docblock:
A function that would specify what the button should do when the `onKeyDown` event is triggered.
For example, this could handle using the `Escape` key to trigger the button's action.
The default is an empty function.

description.text:
A function that would specify what the button should do when the `onKeyDown` event is triggered.
For example, this could handle using the `Escape` key to trigger the button's action.
The default is an empty function.

props.name: type
props.docblock: Used to set the `type` attribute on the `button` tag.  The default type is `button`.

description.text: Used to set the `type` attribute on the `button` tag.  The default type is `button`.

props.name: variant
props.docblock:
Specifies variant to use.
Can be on of the base variants: `primary`, `secondary`, `success`, `danger`, `warning`, `info`, `dark`,
`light`, `link`

as well as one of the customized variants (= base variant prefixed with `inverse-`, `outline-`
or `inverse-outline-`)

description.text:
Specifies variant to use.
Can be on of the base variants: `primary`, `secondary`, `success`, `danger`, `warning`, `info`, `dark`,
`light`, `link`

as well as one of the customized variants (= base variant prefixed with `inverse-`, `outline-`
or `inverse-outline-`)

props.name: iconBefore
props.docblock:
An icon component to render.
Example import of a Paragon icon component: `import { Check } from '@edx/paragon/icons';`

description.text:
An icon component to render.
Example import of a Paragon icon component: `import { Check } from '@edx/paragon/icons';`

props.name: iconAfter
props.docblock:
An icon component to render.
Example import of a Paragon icon component: `import { Check } from '@edx/paragon/icons';`

description.text:
An icon component to render.
Example import of a Paragon icon component: `import { Check } from '@edx/paragon/icons';`
